lines.gurmukhi: logn mY logwcwr Aink pRkwr ipAwr imQn ibauhwr duKdweI phcwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Logan Mai Logaachaar Anik Prakaar Piaara , Midan Biuhaar Doukhadaaee Pahachaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: There are several types of worldly loves but all these are false and considered a source of distress.

lines.gurmukhi: byd imrjwdw mY khq hY kQw Anyk sunIAY n qYsI pRIiq mn mY n mwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Bayd Mirajaadaa Mai Kahat Hai Kadaa Anayka , Souneeai N Taisee Preeti Man Mai N Maaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Several love episodes are found used in the Vedas in order to explain certain point but none is heard or believed to be anywhere near the love of a Sikh with his Guru and holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn aunmwn mY n jgq Bgq ibKY rwg nwd bwid Awid AMiq hU n jwnIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Ounamaan Mai N Jagat Bhagat Bikhai , Raag Naad Baadi Aadi Anti Hoo N Jaaneeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such true love cannot be found in methods and statements of knowledge, in saying of pious persons in the melodies sung in various modes with accompaniment of musical instruments from one end of world to the other.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sMgiq imlwp ko pRqwpu jYso qYso n qiRlok ibKy Aaur aur AwnIAY ]188]
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Sangati Milaap Ko Prataapu Jaiso , Taiso N Trilok Bikhay Aur Ur Aaneeai ?188?

Shabad OS B.translation: The expression of love between the Sikhs and the holy congregation of the True Guru has unique grandeur and such love cannot find its match in anyone's heart in the three worlds. (188)
